description: Complete AES implementation with support for 128, 192, and 256-bit keys, including all standard AES transformations and both encryption and decryption operations

analysis_points: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) symmetric cipher implementation
Support for multiple key sizes: 128, 192, and 256 bits
Standard AES transformations: SubBytes, ShiftRows, MixColumns, AddRoundKey
S-box and inverse S-box lookup tables for byte substitution
Key expansion algorithm with round constants (RCON)
Galois field multiplication for MixColumns operations
Block cipher mode with 16-byte (128-bit) block size
quantum_threats: Grover's algorithm reduces effective key strength by half
AES-128 provides ~64-bit security against quantum attacks
AES-256 provides ~128-bit security against quantum attacks

difficulty_factors: Standard AES S-box and inverse S-box clearly present
Key expansion with RCON constants visible
All four main AES transformations implemented
Multiple key sizes and corresponding round counts
evaluation_criteria: Recognition of AES S-box and transformation patterns
Identification of standard AES operations and constants
Knowledge of quantum vulnerability (Grover's algorithm impact)
Recognition of different AES key sizes and security levels
